driver.name: GPIO (Raspberry Pi)
driver.description: This driver enables the access to the variety of pins of the Raspberry Pi platform. Devices represent the "General-purpose inputs/outputs (GPIOs) of the Raspberry Pi, generic pins to be used either as input or output.

option.name: Pin
option.description: The pin number, according to the WiringPi Pin Numbering Scheme.

option.name: Broadcom Pin Numbering Scheme
option.description: Use the Broadcom Pin Numbering Scheme.

option.name: Default state
option.description: The default state of the configured pin, immediately set at startup of the driver.

option.name: Shutdown state
option.description: The default state of the configured pin, set at shutdown of the driver.

option.name: Pull resistance
option.description: The pull resistance of the configured pin, immediately set at startup of the driver.

option.name: Shutdown pull resistance
option.description: The default pull resistance of the configured pin, set at shutdown of the driver.

option.name: Edge counter
option.description:
Enable the counting of detected edges.

This setting is only applicable for input pins

option.name: Bounce avoidance time
option.description:
The amount of miliseconds waited, until a new edge detection will be accepted as a received impulse, to avoid bouncing.

This setting is only applicable for edge counting input pins

option.name: Inverted state logic
option.description: Use an inverted pin state logic.

option.name: imp./unit
option.description:
The amount of impulses corresponding to one unit.

This setting is only applicable for edge counting input pins

option.name: Count pulses per interval
option.description:
Count the amount of pulses during a sampling interval, instead of a global counter.

This setting is only applicable for edge counting input pins

option.name: Time derivative
option.description:
Calculate the time derivative of counted pulses by the time unit.

This setting is only applicable for edge counting input pins
